name: Burj Khalifa
description: The Burj Khalifa is the tallest building in the world, featuring a neo-futuristic design inspired by Islamic architecture. It houses offices, residences, a hotel, and observation decks.

name: Merdeka 118
description: Merdeka 118 is the tallest building in Southeast Asia and the second-tallest in the world. Its crystalline design symbolizes Malaysia’s independence, and it contains offices, retail, a hotel, and an observation deck.

name: Shanghai Tower
description: Shanghai Tower’s twisting glass design reduces wind loads and improves energy efficiency. It features offices, retail, hotels, and the world’s highest indoor observation deck.

name: Abraj Al-Bait Clock Tower
description: This tower complex overlooks the Great Mosque of Mecca. Its massive clock face is visible from 25 km away, and it provides hotel accommodations for pilgrims.

name: Ping An International Finance Centre
description: Headquarters of Ping An Insurance, the tower is a modern glass-and-steel landmark. It includes offices, retail space, and an observation deck with panoramic views.

name: Lotte World Tower
description: South Korea’s tallest building, its sleek tapered design reflects traditional Korean ceramics. It houses luxury residences, offices, a hotel, and the Sky Deck, one of the world’s highest glass-floored observatories.

name: One World Trade Center
description: Also known as the Freedom Tower, it was built on the original World Trade Center site. It symbolizes resilience and primarily serves as office space with an observation deck.

name: Guangzhou CTF Finance Centre
description: This mixed-use tower contains offices, residences, and a hotel. It is known for housing some of the fastest elevators in the world, traveling at nearly 72 km/h.

name: Tianjin CTF Finance Centre
description: Featuring a curved, tapering design for aerodynamic efficiency, the tower is home to offices, luxury residences, and a hotel. It is the tallest building in Tianjin.

name: CITIC Tower (China Zun)
description: Nicknamed 'China Zun' after an ancient wine vessel, its shape represents prosperity. The building contains offices and is the tallest structure in Beijing.

name: Taipei 101
description: Once the world’s tallest building, Taipei 101 is designed to withstand typhoons and earthquakes. It has offices, restaurants, a shopping mall, and an observatory.

name: Shanghai World Financial Center
description: Nicknamed 'the bottle opener' due to its unique aperture at the top, this skyscraper hosts offices, hotels, and observation decks.

name: International Commerce Centre
description: Hong Kong’s tallest building, ICC houses offices, the Ritz-Carlton Hotel, and an observation deck with panoramic views of Victoria Harbour.

name: Central Park Tower
description: Also called the Nordstrom Tower, it is the world’s tallest residential building. Its luxury condominiums are among the most expensive real estate globally.

name: Lakhta Center
description: Europe’s tallest building, the Lakhta Center features a twisting glass design. It serves as the headquarters of Gazprom and includes offices, research facilities, and a public observation deck.

name: Landmark 81
description: Vietnam’s tallest building, Landmark 81 contains residences, hotels, shopping, and entertainment spaces. Its design is inspired by bamboo clusters symbolizing growth and prosperity.

name: Changsha IFS Tower T1
description: Part of the Changsha IFS complex, this tower houses offices, luxury residences, and retail spaces. It is the tallest building in central China.

name: Petronas Tower 1
description: One of the famous twin towers, designed with Islamic-inspired motifs. It is connected to its twin by a skybridge at the 41st and 42nd floors.

name: Petronas Tower 2
description: The second of the iconic Petronas Twin Towers, once the tallest buildings in the world. It features office spaces and connects to Tower 1 via the skybridge.

name: Zifeng Tower
description: Zifeng Tower combines offices, retail, a hotel, and a public observatory. Its stepped design reflects Nanjing’s history and traditional Chinese pagodas.

name: The Exchange 106
description: The tallest office building in Malaysia, The Exchange 106 has a crystalline façade with an illuminated crown. It serves as the centerpiece of the Tun Razak Exchange financial district.

name: Willis Tower (Sears Tower)
description: Formerly the tallest building in the world, Willis Tower remains a Chicago icon. It is famous for its Skydeck with glass balconies extending outward for thrilling views.

name: KK100
description: KK100 features a sleek curved profile and serves as a mixed-use tower. It contains offices, a hotel, and retail spaces, symbolizing Shenzhen’s rapid growth.

name: Guangzhou International Finance Center
description: Also known as the West Tower, it complements the Guangzhou CTF Finance Centre. The building has offices, a hotel, and a rooftop helipad.

name: Wuhan Center Tower
description: The tallest building in Wuhan, this tower is designed to resist seismic activity. It serves as a mixed-use skyscraper with offices, residences, and hotel facilities.

name: 111 West 57th Street
description: Nicknamed the Steinway Tower, it is the world’s slenderest skyscraper with a dramatic height-to-width ratio. It houses ultra-luxury residential apartments overlooking Central Park.

name: Jin Mao Tower
description: Blending modern design with traditional Chinese pagoda forms, Jin Mao Tower is an iconic Shanghai landmark. It contains offices, a shopping mall, and the Grand Hyatt hotel.

name: Marina 101
description: Marina 101 is Dubai’s tallest residential building. It combines hotel floors operated by Hard Rock with luxury apartments above.

name: Princess Tower
description: Once the tallest residential building in the world, Princess Tower dominates Dubai Marina’s skyline. It houses over 700 luxury apartments and penthouses.

name: Al Hamra Tower
description: The tallest building in Kuwait, Al Hamra Tower features a striking asymmetrical façade with a curving stone wall. It is primarily an office tower with retail and leisure spaces.

name: 23 Marina
description: A luxury residential skyscraper in Dubai Marina, 23 Marina offers duplex apartments, private elevators, and swimming pools, catering to high-end urban living.

name: CITIC Plaza
description: Once the world’s tallest concrete building, CITIC Plaza remains a Guangzhou landmark. It primarily houses offices and is surrounded by other commercial towers.

name: Shun Hing Square
description: Also known as Diwang Building, this tower was Shenzhen’s tallest for many years. It includes offices, a shopping mall, and an observation deck.

name: Vincy Tower (Elite Residence)
description: Elite Residence, located near Dubai Marina, is a luxury residential tower offering over 600 private apartments and amenities such as pools, spas, and gyms.

name: Empire State Building
description: An Art Deco masterpiece and former tallest building in the world, the Empire State Building is a cultural icon with offices, observatories, and illuminated spire lighting.

name: Elite Residence
description: Overlooking Palm Jumeirah, Elite Residence is a residential skyscraper with luxury apartments, health clubs, swimming pools, and panoramic sea views.

name: The Address Boulevard
description: A five-star hotel and serviced residence, The Address Boulevard connects directly to The Dubai Mall. It features luxurious suites, restaurants, and a spa.

name: Almas Tower
description: Located in Jumeirah Lakes Towers, Almas Tower is home to the Dubai Multi Commodities Centre. Its diamond-inspired design reflects its role in the jewelry trade.

name: JW Marriott Marquis Hotel Dubai Tower 1
description: One of the world’s tallest hotels, Tower 1 of the JW Marriott Marquis features luxury rooms, restaurants, and event spaces for conferences and weddings.

name: JW Marriott Marquis Hotel Dubai Tower 2
description: Twin to Tower 1, this skyscraper completes the JW Marriott Marquis complex. Together, the towers offer over 1,600 hotel rooms and extensive hospitality facilities.

name: Emirates Tower One
description: Part of the Emirates Towers complex, this triangular-shaped skyscraper primarily serves as an office building and is connected to its hotel twin by a shopping boulevard.

name: Bank of China Tower
description: A striking glass-clad tower with triangular frameworks, the Bank of China Tower was Hong Kong’s tallest building for years and remains a major symbol of the city’s skyline.

name: Burj Mohammed Bin Rashid
description: The tallest building in Abu Dhabi, this tower is part of the World Trade Center complex and features luxury apartments, shopping, and leisure facilities.

name: OKO South Tower
description: Located in the Moscow International Business Center, the OKO South Tower is a mixed-use skyscraper with offices, residences, and restaurants.

name: The Torch
description: Once the world’s tallest residential building, The Torch is a prominent Dubai Marina tower with over 600 apartments. It has twice experienced significant fires but remains occupied.

name: Princess Tower
description: An iconic residential skyscraper in Dubai Marina, Princess Tower has over 700 apartments, penthouses, and amenities such as swimming pools and gyms.

name: Keangnam Hanoi Landmark Tower
description: Vietnam’s tallest building until Landmark 81, it features offices, luxury residences, and the InterContinental Hanoi Landmark72 Hotel.

name: Four Seasons Place Kuala Lumpur
description: A luxury skyscraper next to the Petronas Towers, it includes the Four Seasons Hotel, residences, and retail spaces catering to high-end lifestyles.

name: Kingkey 100
description: Kingkey 100 is a mixed-use skyscraper with offices, retail, and the five-star St. Regis Hotel. It features a unique tapered glass façade dominating Shenzhen’s skyline.

name: Nina Tower
description: Originally planned to be the world’s tallest tower, Nina Tower was scaled down after aviation restrictions. Today, it includes offices, hotels, and shopping areas.
